sentences.sContent: ...it can help him/her become a person of practice rather than a person of words...
...While the practice carries serious health risks for many...
...Simply it came about through good practice trickling down...
...are part of a medical practice tradition...
...The practice of clocking in for an eight-hour workday is a leftover from the days of the Industrial Revolution...
...they can set up the practice of giving premiums or issuing patent certificate to inventors...
...but practice is the key to it is a proverb vividly showing the relationship between knowledge and practice...
...it is by practice that we can apply the knowledge we have obtained from our textbooks to solving practical problems...
...guidelines have heavily influenced the practice of medicine...
...The fine points of the law are decided by the courts and by acceptable common practice over time...
...The chosen children had parents who had very actively supervised music lessons and daily practice from young ages...
...She is said to practice smiling in front of the mirror for hours everyday before walking up onto the stage...
...yet there has been surprisingly little research on how the long-trumpeted practice of setting goals may have contributed to the current economic crisis...
...What does the author think of the practice of enforcing quotas for women executives...
...Women with red or golden hair are victims of the common practice of stereotyping...

phrases.pCn: 在实践中；实际上，事实上
教学实习（师范院校学生的）；试教
最佳实务，最佳实践；最佳做法，最优方法；典范做法

words.tran: 可用的；行得通的；可实行的
熟练的；有经验的；老练的（等于practised）
实用性，实际性；实际，实例
实践；练习；惯做（practise的过去分词）
练习，实践；实施，实行；从事

trans.tranOther: something that people do often, especially a particular way of doing something or a social or religious custom
